questions.passage: The following text is from the 1924 short story 'The Gift of the Magi' by O. Henry. Della and Jim are a young married couple with very little money. Della has just sold her long, beautiful hair to buy a gift for Jim.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the main purpose of the text?
options: To illustrate the financial struggles of a young couple.
To describe Della's physical appearance in detail.
To show the depth of Della's love and sacrifice for Jim.
To build suspense about the gift Jim will receive.
questions.answer: To show the depth of Della's love and sacrifice for Jim.

questions.passage: A recent study on urban wildlife has found that raccoons are exceptionally good at remembering the solutions to complex problems. For over a year, researchers presented a group of raccoons with a puzzle box that required a multi-step sequence to open. Even after six months without seeing the box, most raccoons were able to open it on their first try, demonstrating remarkable long-term memory.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?
options: Raccoons are more intelligent than other urban animals.
Researchers have been studying raccoons for over a year.
Raccoons possess impressive long-term memory for problem-solving tasks.
Puzzle boxes are a good way to test animal intelligence.
questions.answer: Raccoons possess impressive long-term memory for problem-solving tasks.

questions.question: If 3x - 7 = 8, what is the value of 6x?
A circle has a circumference of 36π. What is the area of the circle?
